name: Tributary condition and impact
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: Tributaries stable, matching reference (flow, quality, form), with no major flash/pollution surges.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: At confluences, visually assess flow stability and turbidity. Supplement with available impairment lists and local monitoring data.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Widespread severely altered tributaries or severe pollution at many confluences
Criteria: Widespread severely altered tributaries or severe pollution at many confluences

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Multiple significantly altered tributaries with frequent sediment plumes
Criteria: Multiple significantly altered tributaries with frequent sediment plumes

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: One or two moderately altered tributaries with occasional elevated turbidity
Criteria: One or two moderately altered tributaries with occasional elevated turbidity

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Stability and turbidity at confluences during storms
Criteria: Mostly natural tributaries with stable flows and typical sediment loads

references: Field observations with turbidity tube or meter
